article:
A 'clonogenic assay' is a microbiology technique for studying the effectiveness
of specific agents on the survival and proliferation of cells. It is frequently
used in cancer research laboratories to determine the effect of drugs or
radiation on proliferating tumor cells as well as for titration of
Cell-killing Particles (CKPs) in virus stocks.

Although this technique can provide accurate results, the assay is time-
consuming to set up and analyse and can only provide data on tumor cells that
can grow in culture. The word "clonogenic" refers to the fact that these cells
are clones of one another.
